author: Christopher
title: Great for fun, functionality could be greatly improved
content:
I actually really like the concept of the product. It is fun just to play around with, but difficult to operate, which I'll go into detail about later. The built-in hub isn't necessary, unless you plan on buying one smart light bulb are a time because the packs come with a hub free (an echo dot is sufficient and cheaper). The speaker quality is great for music and can be increased fairly loud without distortion.

Now for the difficulty with operating. For starters, your echo doesn't have many bells and whistles prepackaged. You have to search skills, which are kind of like apps or lessons to teach Alexa. There are many different skills you can teach Alexa, so make sure you have time to look through them. Now you've taught Alexa skills, but for every skill you must remember how to communicate exactly as instructed on the skill page or Alexa will not understand (e.g. "Alexa, tell <skill name> to perform such and such task). If you don't remember the phrases to get Alexa to perform the skill you can always look through your app and under skills to find directions. Who will remember all the specific wording for each skill? Plus, the whole point in speaking to Alexa is that it's hands-free, so looking at the app for directions isn't convenient. It gets very frustrating if you don't have the Alexa app handy. Next, if you plan on controlling plugs or lights with Alexa you have to download apps from the manufacturer. Your now cluttered phone is even more cluttered and you don't speak the same language as Alexa. She also has difficulty understanding a lot of questions and you have to rephrase them several times for her to give you any answer.

I love, love, love the functions I can remember the wording for Alexa to perform the task. There are so many things Alexa can do that listing them would make this review entirely too long. I will list my favorites and most useful to me.
Turns on lights or plugs.  Groups lights, traffic report, weather, and many other functions together to be performed with one command (e.g. "Alexa, good morning").  Orders pizza.  Tells jokes.  Gives answers to questions you have.  Controls TV.  Sends messages and makes calls.  Adds things to grocery lists.  Sets reminders so you won't forget things.  Adds appointments to your phone or email linked calendar.  Helps kids with homework.  Plays games for adults and kids.

author: Kelly Bialk
title: Just get the Echo, not the Echo Plus!
content: This is the first review I have ever done. I own  the Amazon Echo, 5 Echo dots, and then I just purchased the Echo Plus. The reason I did it was that I perceived it was an “upgrade” because you no longer need a hub to connect your lights, etc.  That is true, however the Echo Plus does not offer the same functionality without a Phillips Hub. Your can’t turn your lights color easily, nor can you set up automations easily. You need the hub to do this (I confirmed this when I called their customer service).  Additionally, Alexa does not seem to hear as well as it does with my regular Echo.  Overall I am disappointed with this produce.

author: Bruce7512
title: Great when it works . . .
content:
First let me say that I love the concept of this device.  I received it as a Christmas gift.  Set up was simple.  It worked well.
Fast forward 2 weeks.  One day it refused to respond e
With anything other than "I'm having trouble understanding right now.  Please try later.  The first time it lasted for nearly 3 days, until I pulled the plug with the intention of returning it.  I don't need a $150 paperweight.
Before packing it back into the box, I tried plugging it in again.  To my surprise it worked, although I had to go through the setup routine again.  But a few days later the same thing occurred.  So I again unplugged it, waited a few minutes and plugged it back into the electrical socket, and after again going through the setup routine, it worked as before.
Since then, this has become a daily occurrence.  We have had no electrical or internet outages.  Nor have we been hacked.  It is simply unconscionable to market a piece of junk like this for $150 when it clearly is not ready for  time.  I do not recommend anyone spend their hard-earned money on this "gadget."

language? Not to mention, only understand English, I think they should expand quickly to other languages ​​such as Spanish if they do not want Google to win the Latino market.

the calls are of poor quality, the person I call them does not recognize my voice or fully understand what I say.

there is a news app in Spanish but alexa reads them and reads them really badly, they should include some direct telemundo platform or something like that.

author: MG in NY
title: Customer Service Disappointing.
content:
Let me edit this review and say that -- after 2 1/2 HOURS on the phone and several additional days of back and forth, Amazon did ultimately replace this defective Echo.

I'll also say that I have several Echos and I like them quite a bit.  And let me also say as a bona fide tech geek that even great equipment can have individual defective units.

So, it's not the device that's my problem.  My problem is that the first level of tech support are not only poorly trained but have no authority to resolve the issue.  Was on the phone for more than TWO HOURS with a tech.  I've deleted the absurd convo but suffice it to say it was embarrassing.  He didn't seem to understand that the Plus even has a Hub, nor what a Hub does in relation to the normal Echo capabilities.  Consequently, he couldn't grasp how the Echo could be working but the Hub not.  Nor that light bulbs cannot work without a hub of some kind.  Nor that you can't "reset" a light bulb other then by turning it on and off.

It was ultimately escalated and the unit replaced.  But the process was ridiculous for a device of this cost.

Compare this experience with Apple.  I had a pair of Beat Headphones that cost more than twice the price of the Echo.  I'll spare the boring technical problem but it had to do with not being able to reset them to resolve a connectivity issue.  I got to the Apple store and, as these things sometimes go, I couldn't actually replicate the problem -- they were temporarily working fine.  The response of Apple was, "yeah, don't worry about it, we are aware that this is an issue from time to time.  So let us just swap you out for a new pair."

THAT'S how customer service works.

Original review:

Let me begin by saying that I've been a huge fan of Amazon, a shareholder and a Prime Member for as long as I can remember.  This is my THIRD Echo device and I had no problems with the prior ones.  So I would think they would jump to make me happy on this one.  First the device had problems responding, would say it lost the internet connection despite the fact that the other two Echos worked fine.  Then the hub could no longer find the smart devices that it had been connected to and worked fine with for two months.  I assumed the tech team would jump to make this right.  I was on the phone for MORE THAN TWO HOURS with people who seemed to know much less about Amazon's devices than I do but didn't seem to have the authority to replace an $88 device.  What follows is the THIRD support conversation.  You'll see it's pretty incredible.

author: Rainmoth
title: What a disappointment. Also
content:
I am enjoying getting to know Alexa, although she is a bit hard of hearing at times.  I have my Echo connected to my Ring doorbell.  I thought it would be able to audibly answer my door, but it seems I need to buy the Echo show, for that feature (I did not really want the image, just the voice.
The Ring provides the image, when I use my phone. ).  What a disappointment.  Also, I have not determined how to get the Echo to make phone calls without buying the Echo connect.  I am disappointed that it seems I need to buy a more expensive Echo model and other accessories to get Alexa to really be more helpful to me. Also, Amazon support is not really helpful with learning to use the Echo.

I originally thought it was because I was talking to low but I use the same tone with my dot and it understands perfectly. Now it won’t even recognize the wake word unless I’m half yelling and righ5 near it. I believe no one should waste there money on this system and just buy the dot it’s cheaper and works far better.

Having the Echo Dot in the upstairs bedroom enables added utility when something has been forgotten and being the "new" alarm clock waking us to nice music instead of blaring alarm noise.

author: Justin H Ryan
title: I would like to tell you that I have a reason to ...
content: I would like to tell you that I have a reason to hate it like the speakers suck, or the color, or the shape or even the way it smells, but I can honestly say the number reason I hate this device is I have tried to set it up 3x's now to no avail, I have 4 other Echo devices already that I set up and use quite regularly, I have reset my phone (Galaxy S8), checked the app for updates, I have cycled power to the Echo unit with each attempt. I work in the network/technology industry for a living and have for over 20 years now, so lack of experience or knowledge is not the problem here. I used the app and the device even tells me it is connected and to follow the app to continue set up, the set up screen just continues to roll the 3 dots around the screen for about 5 minutes before the app locks up on my phone and I have to force the app to close, restart my phone and the Echo and try again. I figured 3x's was enough, it shouldn't be that hard a techie, I can only imagine how bad this will prove to be for people whom have no clue about technology....I hope they won't call me I'll tell em to send the product back!

author: orion
title: The basic device works great. The more rich sound makes it a good ...
content: The basic device works great.  The more rich sound makes it a good compliment to my Echo, also placed within earshot.  Works kind of like a subwoofer/high range speaker system.  I am disappointed in the functionality of the Hub component however.  It will control Phillips bulbs and other switches, but only for on-off functions.  Considering that Alexa has alarm and reminder functionality, one would expect to be able to schedule the hub functions in a like manner.  Not.  I would have been better off purchasing the non-hub Echo.

Its easy to integrate with services. And it plays my Amazon music and Audible books easily!  The light I got with it is so handy!  I got my parents a Dot.  And calls! I love that!  The speaker phone didn't work well from a distance - not like the voice commands - it hears from pretty far away!  I love it.

author: tinker bell
title: Reminder software issue
content:
I purchased two Echo plus and one Echo Dot within the last month. Several days ago all Echo devices started to have a problem simultaneously: Alexa announces a new reminder (that was placed in the last several days) FOUR times (normally twice). I spent over an hour with two customer service people both of whom had no idea how to fix the problem. One of whom apparently did not know what a reminder tab of the Alexa desktop app looks like. The other started to Google the problem although I had told her I Googled it myself already before contacting Amazon. Since both of them were clueless as to how to approach the issue, I asked to speak with a more knowledgeable tech support rep but they denied my request.

Since this is clearly a software issue affecting all of my Echo devices under a single Alexa account, I prefer not to factory reset all devices (I have many routines set up and smart devices connected) and frankly I do not believe that will solve the problem. For now I tell Alexa to “stop” before she repeats the announcement four times. In the meantime, I hope that Amazon will fix this type of software bug as soon as it arises and offer more knowledgeable tech support people to customers. Previously I posted a five-star rating and a positive review under Echo Pus. I edited my original Echo Plus review and reduced the star rating. If Amazon really strives for the best customer service, they have an ample room for improvement.

author: Erin Hallis
title: Thought this was supposed to be the "smartest" one?
content:
I have the Echo 2nd Gen, two Dots, and the Plus....and the Plus is supposed to be the most advanced I thought? I purchased it so that I wouldn't have to buy hubs for all my different smart devices--while it does make it super easy to set things up, it seems to be the "most dumb" of all my Echoes.  My Dot all the way in the kitchen picks up what I'm saying even if I'm a foot away from the Plus! It's very annoying. I've tried putting them even farther apart, but it doesn't help. I hope it's just something wrong with this particular Plus. I'm returning it for a new one because I'm not about to spend $160 on something that doesn't do what it promised!!
Honestly, I think my Echo 2nd Gen has a better speaker, too.

title: Had brief bluetooth glitched that resolved themselves. Great sound and Alexa is a great feature
content: Over all an excellent device. Great sound quality and alexa makes using this device relatively simple. There was a brief sound glitch via bluetooth with my Samsung Galaxy S8. Whenever I click a key or open an app the sound on the echo stops for about a second then continues. This glitch happened the first day and hasn't done it since, I assume an update fixed it. Alexa responds well as long as the device is on a smooth surface without any noise generating devices near her (i.e. dont have her on the floor or counter next to a desk fan or you will have to yell at her). Aside from the brief bluetooth glitch this product is great and I would highly recommend it!

author: wildwoodla
title: Perfect for Beginner entry into Smart Home with limited Internet Infrastructure
content:
There are many excellent reviews of the new Echo Plus here, so this review is from the POV of someone with limited connection infrastructure, e.g., very rural area, no internet or cable, only satellite service offered, but no signal due to heavy tree cover, beginner smart home user. I never dreamed an Echo would work for me, much less the Echo Plus or smart home. I broke down & purchased an Echo on Prime Day June, 2017 just to try. I receive my internet service solely through an AT&T Velocity hotspot device, typically with only 1 bar of service. I was so excited that the Echo worked perfectly & decided to go out on another limb, purchasing the Echo Plus w/included Hue bulb on Cyber Monday, as well as a Fire TV Stick, figuring I was really pushing the envelope that any would work.  All devices worked perfectly! I now have the meager beginnings of a smart home as well as Alexa functionality. I can't tell you how surprised I am! There is an 8-device limit for the hotspot, so wi-fi smart devices are out of the question for me & not sure I have enough signal for any to work anyway. Using the Echo Plus as my only hub, the included Hue bulb connected in seconds, while also tying in with my 1st Echo. So I can use either of the 2 Echos to control the light bulb, connected to a lamp in my living room. What is ideal for my situation is that the Hue bulb does not "count" as a wi-fi device, so does not go toward my device count/limit on the hotspot. Apparently, it is connected directly to the Echo Plus hub. Currently, with one bar of hotspot service, I'm running the Echo Plus, Echo, Fire tablet, Fire TV Stick & Galaxy Express 3 cell, & every now & then, an Echo Tap--all at one time with excellent results! Everything works as if I have hard wired cable or internet, which is simply amazing. Movies, music, etc. run flawlessly.
ALEXA - I don't have a lot of space on my cell, so all I need is the Alexa app to control the bulb when away from home, no need for a separate app AND I already have the Alexa app on my tablet & of course, use Alexa on both Echo's & a Tap.
SMART HOME - The Echo Plus has opened up the smart home market for me. Although it appears limited to the Zigbee IoT protcol, the available choices are varied enough that there are switches, more bulbs, door locks & plugs I'll be able to use now. This thing just came out, so as time goes by, I'm sure more & more skills & IoT stuff will become available. I'm sure the folks at Amazon will make improvements to capabilities as well. And I can do it all with just 1 Echo Plus - no need for additional hubs or devices with my limited internet!
SOUND - I found my 1st Echo sound pretty decent. I am by no means an audiophile, but IMHO Echo Plus sound greatly improved over the Echo. Much richer, more robust & MUCH better bass - yay! My 1st Echo sounds "tinny" now, compared to the Echo Plus.
I am beyond delighted with the performance of the Echo Plus & kudos to Amazon for this "upgrade" to the Echo. I would highly recommend the Echo Plus, especially for those just entering the smart home market with internet challenges. I LOVE MY ECHO PLUS!!!!!

author: Samuel Cabrera
title: Excelent addition...  if you have smart home devices
content: I received this as a gift and was not planning on getting one, and was pleasantly surprised with the capabilities. I had recently purchased some smart light switches and was just using them via the provided Android app which was fine. Once I got the Echo, I discovered that the switches where compatible and adding voice commands to the house is really a leap forward. The added Phillips Hue light bulb was also a nice bonus that can help turn any lamp into a smart device with dimming capabilities. I ended up purchasing a couple more Echo devices to have throughout the house to use the "Drop In"  skill as an intercom. I am constantly discovering new useful skills that can help me through the day and find myself relying more on the Echo devices and the Alexa app for the smartphone.

author: blogthis
title: Missing original Ethernet RJ45 jack, that is very disappointing
content:
I was thinking I'd get the same Amazon Echo as the original, but with the "Plus" only meaning built-in hub.

Unfortunately, Amazon has REMOVED the RJ45 Ethernet Jack, so it is Wi-Fi ONLY. I would have paid more for the Ethernet RJ45 Jack back.

I think remving the Ethernet RJ45 jack was was a horrible mistake by Amazon, and I would've paid more for it..... otherwise yes it does usually work.. If and when it an find a channel on my overloaded wifi router.

I think when Amazon realized their mistake on trying to save a buck they came out with the Amazon Ethernet RJ45 adapter... but unfortunately it just barely works if at all, read its reviews and you'll see it's very disappointing too. Amazon should've left it built-in.

I was able to integrate Phillips Hue light bulbs (no Phillips hub), Nexx Garage door opener, and some generic smart switch to the Echo without ANY issues. I'm pleased. My next device will probably be the Echobee or Next thermostat. I'm still looking...

author: LKLD
title: Hub, yes! Questions, no.
content:
I've only had it a little more than 2 weeks, so take that into consideration.

What it does well, is help automate your home, with it's built in hub. I've added bulbs and a led light strip, so far, and it's done it's job flawlessly. I do plan to continue adding on with a thermostat and security cameras.

What it doesn't do well is answering questions. Approximately 60% of the time, Alexa doesn't understand the question. Which really means she doesn't have an answer. While watching the Bucs/Dolphins game on tv, I asked Alexa for the score, she told me they play next week. They had a scheduled bye this week,but hurricane Irma took that away week one.

Arbitrary questions don't get answered very often, specific business, weather, sports questions are generally answered.

I'm hoping that updates will help with this.

My son ordered a GoControl thermostat to work with my new toy but I would have to order a different hub that would talk to the thermostat and to the Echo/Alexa so I returned that thermostat and when I get the refund I am ordering the Ecobee 3 Lite which is specifically made to work with Echo/Alexa.  I look forward to the future to see what will be available...

title: I will start buy saying that I love the sound quality and the color of this model
content: I will start buy saying that I love the sound quality and the color of this model. This is my 3rd Amazon Echo; I love them all and use them every day! For some reason, this particular model sometimes has trouble staying connected to the internet. I have tested this with my other Echo's in the same spot all around the house. The echo dot and original echo will stay connected without a problem, while this one keeps stopping and reconnecting. Thankfully, this does not happen every day. I was also disappointed to learn that the price dropped around $30 within a week of purchase and amazon refused to adjust the price; I had to go through the hassle of returning and re-buying the product. Given that this is an Amazon product, I see this as poor customer service.

author: Wendy Darling
title: Easy setup of ZigBee devices without additional hub
content: The ZigBee addition was really helpful. All you have to do is power up the ZigBee device and tell Alexa to discover your devices. She finds them and gives them a generic name which you can then change in the Alexa app. The only reason I gave 4 stars is this device seems to have more difficulty understanding and even waking. I don’t know if it has to with the ZigBee or not. More likely it’s just a manufacturer variation.

author: CLN
title: Great!
content: I have programmed this echo to turn on and off lights (I ordered more bulbs), lock my Schlage front door lock and my alarm system. It was so easy to set up through my Alexa app!  Once you have the Echo plus the other Echos will work to be smart hubs. So you don’t have to be within voice distance to the plus. I have 4 Echos in my home and can play music on all of them at the same time allowing me to have a sound system without any hard wiring.  Easy to set up and use. Note that the Echo dots do not have the great speakers that the regular Echo and Echo plus do so you don’t get the  same quality of sound. But Amazon has done an excellent job with the Echo. No complaints I highly recommend!

author: Jeff Curtis
title: I love my Alexa
content: I have only had my echo plus for three weeks.  I have four Phillips Hue bulbs and a Nest Thermostat linked.  The linking process is about as easy as it can be.  I have the ability to control each bulb individually or in groups.  There is a learning curve with dimming the lights.  Alexa works off of a 1 through 10 scale for light brightness and speaker volume.  This is something I did not read in any of the information I had prior to getting the echo plus or with the paperwork that came with it.  It would be a good idea for the manufacturer to provide that information.  Once you discover how to adjust levels, the system works really well.

title: Doesn't do much
content: We finally got an "Alexa" so we could turn our Hue lights on and off verbally--and not need our cell phones handy.  The Echo works fine for that.  However, we aren't terribly sure what the point of it is otherwise.  It makes a nice voice-activated speaker, but its other "skills" are well...pointless.  Alexa Be Mean...fun for two minutes.  Alexa Play Waterfall Sounds...fun for two minutes.  There are pages and pages of skills, but we can't locate any that seem to be substantive.  Maybe there will be more in the future.  We're keeping since it does control our Hue lights, but we returned another we had gotten for another part of the house.

author: Perry Barone
title: Cool piece of technology
content:
Setup was easy and already have it controlling our Phillips Hue lights. The built in hub means not needing hubs for the other technology we may add. Next will be getting it setup to control our Fire Boxes with just voice commands.
***UPDATE***
Three months later and it won't connect to our wifi. I went so far as to perform a factory reset on it and went through the setup again and it just will not connect to our wifi even though it was connected for three months. Even moved it to the same room as the router and still nothing. The only option left for me is to return it for a replacement.

author: Murdervan
title: Good idea poorly executed
content: If you are ordering this for the hub functionality go with Samsung smart things hub instead. The lack of z-wave on echo plus is a terrible idea.  I am returning mine and sticking with my smart things hub.  Smart things gives a better routine menu and more customisation as far as lights locks and sensors including proximity to your home.  Echo plus is good if you want to control lighting in a room or 2 but not good for an actual smart home. I expected for from Amazon.

author: Amanda Chavez
title: Love it, but it needs some work
content: I really enjoy it but i have yet to connect my smart home devices and there are times it doesnt understand me, or i have to repeat myself multiple times . Other instances there are no answers for specific questions and alexa doesnt understand / speak spanish which is important as my inlaws family mainly speaks nothing but spanish and understands very little english. I wish that there were an option to have it speak / comprehend spanish as it would help. I do find it very useful for my kids and home life . There are skills that can be applied that make them excited to learn and get ready in the morning , alexa can set multiple timers for when im cooking which is really useful and makes my life a million times easier. For the most part i personally use it for helping create lists , timers, and listening to music while i clean and cook. I use pandora and amazon music unlimited and i like to use both - but if i ask for a spanish song she doesnt understand. I can only ask for an artists name that sings in spanish. The sound level is pretty decent on it . I will update when i finally connect my nest and hue lightbulbs but for now i have too much home improving to do . At the end of the day i only reccomend if you speak in english as a 1st langauge or speak it very fluently . I liked this one so much i bought my husband a dot for work

author: Mitless
title: It's a Plus-plus Product!
content: Great Product! We have been using the Amazon Echo products since the start. From several commands, to news, weather, timer, alarms, jokes and the latest Amazon Music, Drop-Ins, Phone calls, linking to Fire TV Stick, games, multi-room music, acting as a hub; we really are enjoying this product. My son says no need using the Drop-in since we have a small house and he can hear me when waking him up. For the sound; I specifically use the volume loudness no. 6 thru 8. My ears are still sensitive enough to distinguish the different instruments on the song/music on the Echo Plus. Depending on the Song and Genre being played, I can say the speaker is really good and acceptable. There will always be better speakers (branded and more expensive ones) around. But, if you are in the Amazon eco(Echo)-system, I highly recommend this product.

author: Kelly
title: Very handy smart speaker that works great
content:
Love my Echo!!! The built in hub works great and easily connected with the light bulb we purchased with it.  And I would now be lost without being able to shout out "Alexa, add <blank> to my shopping list> and then simply pull up my shopping list in the store!!!  I bought this as a gift for my husband and asked him "Not sure why you want one but ok".  Now, I'm hooked!!

However, she doesn't seem very "smart" when asking her regular Google type questions--she seems to come back with "I don't know" type of answers way too often.  Ask our phones the same things and it will pull right up.  So, some work to do there.

Also some warning that it was having issues would be great.  The timer stopped working recently and I didn't know it.  I was using it while cooking, so that wasn't good.  She confirmed she set the timer but nothing was actually set.  When I unplugged it/plugged it back in, all was well but I would have expected it would have told me it couldn't set the timer.

author: Sometimes happy
title: The pairing of Echo Plus(s) to multiple areas and the enjoyment!!
content: I have 2 Echo Plus's in my home and have learned how to pair them so I can go from room to room and not miss a beat of the music!  The sound is awesome!  I have 20+ feet high ceilings and not a lot of cloth hanging around so the music sounds like a concert hall!  I have a third Echo (not a "Plus" version) in my recreation room downstairs, too!  That one is for the kids to listen to their music!  Amazingly though, the downstairs Echo can hear my voice upstairs without me yelling or even opening the basement door!  I did need some tech help from Amazon to learn how to pair the E-Plus's.  The tech was very patient and helped me get through the setup relatively quickly....my slowness, his patience!!  Thoroughly enjoying having the Echo(s)!!

author: New PL user
title: Check compatibility of your smart devices before you switch
content: For anyone just starting to use smart devices and use Amazon services, the Echo Plus does a great job as an assistant, hub and speaker. You should make sure the smart devices will work with the hub and what features of those devices will or won't work. There are many different smart devices that work well and I see more every time I check. If you have been using smart devices with another hub, it may or may not be worth getting until you are ready to change some of them out to newer and compatibly devices with the Echo Plus.

I wish it had a rechargeable battery built in because I don't like unplugging it all the time (how cool would a wireless charging base be for this thing?!). However that's not really an actual complaint: I love my Echo Plus and I love everything Alexa can do! Wonderful item; technology is amazing!

content: The set-up seemed easy but would not complete.  I had to hire some professional help to get it done, and it took him about 45 minutes.  No way could a typical consumer complete that process.

author: Ken Hinds
title: Could never do without my Echo plus and 2 additional echos. All in all have made my life much easier
content: I bought the echo plus for the hub to control lights for now. It often freezes, doesnt complete the task even though it says it did and there is a problem wirh its spatial function with another echo dot I have. It thinks I'm closer to the dot even though Im standing right near the echo plus which is 10 feet away from the dot. I love the music groups as I am able to stream music to all three of my echos when im working around the house. Nice feature but a bit quirky. I love the list feature as I never forget anything at the market anymore or buy things I already have. I also love the alarm and reminder feature. I'll never use a regular alarm clock again, YEAH!. For some families the intercom feature is great, No more yelling to the kids unless it makes you fell better or more important. I also love the light control. I never have to fumble for the lamp switch while in bed and was able to move the lamp off the night stand. Now I can turn them on and off and dim them with my voice.When your older with several trips to the bathroom at night youll really appreciate it. At this point I am so dependent on my 3 echos that I would never be without them. Keep the updates coming Amazon! Keep in mind that you need the echo plus to turn lights on and off.

author: Danealle Orcutt
title: We LOVE our echo plus!
content: This thing is AMAZING!!! We don’t know what we would do without our Alexa! We have one in every room. My kids love theirs as well. I love listening to music while I clean and do dishes. Before I got this I was just using my cell phone and a Bluetooth speaker. It was hard trying to change songs with wet hands from doing the dishes or having to stop my work to go look at the phone and find what I want to listen to! To be able to just tell Alexa what I want it amazing! I don’t have to stop anything I’m doing! And I was able to listen to almost every song I’ve asked for!  Also we love being able to turn off the lights and tv. One night my kids were sleeping in another room and they had fallen asleep. I didn’t want to get out of bed to turn everything off so I just asked Alexa to do it and it was done! AMAZING! Also, while I’m out and about I can call directly to any Alexa in the house. If I have a question for my son, I can call his Alexa in his room and so on! And they can call me directly on my phone while I’m gone! Also I’ve been able to look up numbers and place calls! So great! One of the beat purchase I’ve ever made and we are planning on adding on to our smart home with more smart devices compatible with Alexa!!! This is something that has been so nice to have!

I am impressed with the Echo's seemingly vast reservoir of music on tap but it just can't be played LOUD!

The apps and games are fantastic. There’s everything from trivia and funny apps to role-playing games that test you in a completely different way. The available apps and games are plentiful, and they are steadily growing from a variety of developers.

Also, this can be connected to a variety of other devices or things in your home if you wish to do so. I honestly can say I wish I had more time to explore the capabilities of the Amazon Echo Plus!

author: Philip W. Morris
title: Read this before upgrading from an 1st generation Echo
content:
I had an older echo and the philips hue hub and 7 bulbs. I liked the idea of getting rid of the hue hub and centralize everything into one device, so I bought one. I set it up and asked it to find my devices . . . no joy.  After further research, I found that I needed to disassociate each bulb with the Phillips Hub before I could continue. Did that. Still no joy. After even further research, I found that if the previous process didn't work, I had to associate each bulb manually by removing the bulb, recording the 6 character identifier and entering it into the Alexa app. While that worked, it was incredibly inconvenient considering where several of my bulbs were installed.

OK, so now it's finally ready for play.  Turns out, the Echo Plus has only the most primitive of control capabilities. I can manually turn on and off or dim a bulb.  I can group them and use voice commands.  But . . . I lost all of the use of the recipes I've created on IFTTT. I had some recipes to turn lights on at sunset, turn lights off at sunrise, turn lights on when the Ring Doorbell detects motion.  All gone. I'm really disappointed as I've come to expect excellence from Amazon's products. Hopefully this will be improved ..... soon.

There IS something called "Routines" but it is primitive as well. I can set things to happen at a certain time, but lets say I want the living room lights to come on at 50% at 6:00pm. I cannot select the group called "Living Room". I have to select each light bulb individually. Now, as I add new bulbs and add them to groups, I STILL have to find each routine and change it to include the new bulb.

Amazon . . . . I expected better. It's the hope of improvements (and the thought of the frustration required to undo the setup) that prevents me from sending this one back.

Prospective Buyers - If you already have an Echo. Do not buy this. If you don't have an echo, then it may be worth it provided they fix some of the major oversights like Routines / Groups and no IFTTT hub support.

The speakers are also significantly better. The aren't the best speakers I've ever heard, but they are plenty loud for everybody to be able to hear in my 2000+ sqr. ft. home. The microphone is also very good and can pick up a wake word from nearly anywhere in the house if you raise your voice.

author: shelley blaine
title: I love the echo plus
content: I love the echo plus, it's easy to set up and you can hear clear crisp music or if watching a movie on a tablet, it can even play sound through it instead of the tablet speakers. I'm still learning a lot but the games are a lot of fun. Jeopardy every night.

author: Mary M. Price
title: Alexa
content: I love this product! Great speaker sound for music in a small space.

author: Hard T. Please
title: My 93-year-old Dad likes it
content: I bought this for my elderly father, who just turned 93. He says he's going to live forever and so far, so good. Still, my old man isn't the guy he used to be when he served in the Army during WW2. He doesn't see the numbers on his cordless phone as well as he used to and sometimes he'd like to turn on a light or two without getting up. Now, all he has to do is say, "Alexa, call that damn fool son of mine," and I answer him on my phone or one of my Echos. I even set up his lights from my home and I live he Mass. and he's in Maryland. Five stars from me and I'm  hard to please.

author: S. Buell

author: Don Cresswell
title: ... a lightbulb it was on sale for a really good price. With the built-in hub and voice commands ...
content: I’m an owner of a couple of echo dots I use them  mostly to control the lights and listen to music I’ve recently bought the echo plus because it has a built-in hub and came with a lightbulb it was on sale for a really good price.  With the built-in hub and voice commands it was really easy to add other devices and the sound is unbelievable. I would definitely recommend the echo plus to my family and friends.

author: Doug Geisleman
title: If you're thinking about getting an echo, it's worth the extra cost to get the plus.
content: I previously had the echo dot, and while I wouldn't say anything bad about the dot, the echo plus is a huge improvement. The sound is amazing, and you can now adjust the bass and everything. Adding to that, it makes setting up smart home devices a breeze. No longer having to download multiple apps and enabling skills you just ask Alexa to discover the device and it's done. As long as it's a Zigbee device. If you even think you might set up smart home devices in your house and you're thinking about getting an echo, it's worth the extra cost to get the plus.

Turn on the lights, tell you the score and weather....I’m just beginning to find out how much Alexa can do! I will be adding more Echos to the other rooms to complete the experience. Well done Amazon!!

Unless the support team doesn’t know anything about them, every time I call they ask me to try and get the weather, if it says the weather then it works in there eyes.

The Alexa stuff is all very useful and fun, but I am disappointed. I had read good reviews of this speaker's sound - and this is supposed to be Amazon's best Echo product - but I will likely be returning it and either hooking an Echo Dot up to my own speakers or purchasing a Sonos One.

author: C. Conklin
title: A little disappointed
content:
So I bought the echo plus with the hue bulb, boy was I disappointed in both my purchase and with Amazon. There was nothing I read that said to make the hue bulb work that you also have buy the hue bridge which is another $59.97 or if you buy it with 2 more bulbs it is $69.97. I had always thought that Amazon was above playing those type of games.

I already had an echo dot and had it synced with my Bose for music and I already have an echo dot in my bedroom. From everything I have read now all I needed to do was buy a hue bridge and sync that with the dot and I would than be able to schedule my lights. Also when I went to sign in to the Hue app it asked me if I wanted to signed in with my google account, WHAT! where did that come from, if I had wanted to signed in with my google account I would have bought Googles version of echo.

Also if you have a Vivint alarm system the echo and echo plus connect in the same way, both echos will only lock your front door.

author: DJD
title: I hate that stupid light when I receive a message while ... needs a DND feature that also silences alarms.
content:
Update: I received a reply regarding the message notification informing me that there was a "Do Not Disturb" feature I could turn on. So I replied that I'd try it and I'd update my review if it worked. I did find that feature and turn it on, however, I have not had any messages come through during the set times so I haven't been able to test that. Unfortunately, at 5am this morning it sounded an alarm that I did not set, 2 hours before I needed to wake up, and it jolted me out of a deep sleep so I'm updating my review anyway. I have no idea why this alarm sounded, and neither did Alexa - I asked her why and she said she didn't know. I'm still very unhappy with Echo for disturbing my sleep in yet another more egregious way. Perhaps if the Do Not Disturb feature allowed you to also prevent alarms it would be better. I have no intention of abandoning my favorite sleep app that never jolts me out of a deep sleep, but wakes me gently when I'm not in a deep sleep state and therefore I will never want to use Alexa as an alarm so I'd rather just turn it off so I never have to worry about some phantom alarm that I didn't set jolting me awake while I'm in a deep sleep hours before I need to get up, so NO, I will not be adding any stars. I'm tempted to drop my rating even further, but there are a couple things I do like about using Alexa so I can't discount this device altogether. I just wish they'd hire some better engineers and make it smarter. Things I do like are controlling lights and my Nest thermostat. I also like being able to play music but I really wish they'd allow me to put music preferences in my app. I NEVER want to hear Country music - no offense, I just can't stand it - but Alexa seems to ber obsessed with it so I have to be very specific when I tell her what to play. I kid you not, when I asked her to play meditation music the other day, she actually found a GD country station. Ugh. Stupid. Maybe if I lived in an area rife with country music fans it would make some sense, but I live in Los Angeles which isn't exactly a country music haven. Get smarter Alexa, I'm trying to create a smart home and somethings I think you're the dumbest part of that entire idea.

Original review: I’d rate it a 3 or 4 if there was a way to prevent the green light ring message notification from flashing at night during set hours so it didn’t disturb my sleep. I hate that stupid light when I receive a message while in bed. Also, the reasons I’d only give it a 3 or 4 is that it’s not very smart; nor nearly as smart as Siri. It makes really dumb music choices and if I’m not extremely specific it will play country music almost every time I make a request. This must be a bonus for country music lovers but I’m not one of them and Alexa can’t seem to learn what I like. It also won’t play my Apple music choices; I understand why, but that is a disadvantage for Apple users. Those are a few examples but there are more. To get 4-5 stars Amazon needs to do two things: 1) Make a way for people to stop that stupid green light from flashing when they’re in bed and 2) make Alexa smarter and teach her to learn user’s preferences.

author: Fernando
title: En español si mejor
content: Muy bien

author: Eugene Treftz
title: The Echo Plus seems to handle it all like a champ
content: The hub part was what we were looking for. We have a older home so it was easier to change light bulbs than to change switches. The Echo Plus seems to handle it all like a champ.

author: Joe
title: Echo is easy to install but the real challenge is pairing it ...
content: Echo is easy to install but the real challenge is pairing it with other devices, such as lights and switched..With the vast numbers of suppliers even purchasing one on amazon that is suppose to be Alexa suitable it is still a challenge.  Once paired it works great and makes daily living a little more enjoyable.

author: GJC9801
title: Sounds Great, Has some issues
content: Its a start but I expected much more by now, Something as simple as tell it to turn on certain lights on at dusk and then off at dawn, or even on at Xtime off at X time but it can’t even do that.  this is my 5th echo and second dot So Im not some newbie expecting the world. In my mind you have my geographic coordinates and my time zone either of these things should have been very easy and included but neither are. as for the sound it is far superior to the older units, and this brings up another issue we use the everywhere feature to play the same station or stream through out the house and if you are playing music its ok but if you put on talk radio and you find your ears between 2 units as you walk from room to room you get a horribly annoying echo where they are a couple milliseconds out of sink. before someone comes back and starts blaming my WIFI NO ITS NOT we just had a brand new commercial wifi and network management system installed just like they use in hospitals and office buildings its all Ubiquiti Unifi and there are AC 1200 in room access points in 7 of the 11 rooms in my house and an outdoor unit with an antenna array designed to cover the entire 6 acres of our property, that being said I got my first unit several years ago and have been adding to them over time and they have made some great improvements and many steps backwards teach iteration of updates seems to fix a few quirks and create a few, My most current complaint is how often they light up and start listening when the wake word nor anything like it has been spoken and I changed the wake word to the less likely one so I don't understand why I might be sitting in a room reading a book and the thing will light up and listen when nothing has been said, and when you do talk to it especially the dots you have to speak in a loud tone to get them to trigger. Those are my thoughts from my personal experience, I hope this helps.

author: #WearetheSmiths
title: Alexa is awesome!
content:
When I received this Echo Plus in the mail I noticed there was a small crack around the light ring. Now I could have kept it and used it with the crack, it really was small, but Amazon is such an amazing company that they sent a replacement that same day!  So awesome!

I spent the next hour deciding where I could best use the Philips hue lightbulb and TP-Link plug I purchased with the Echo Plus on cyber Monday.  After the initial set up of the above mentioned accessories, the time to play with said accessories was about to begin.

Now, If you haven't tried your hand at smart home automation, there is a bit of an expense that will be required to start. You can buy a wide variety of smart home hubs here on Amazon, but I would suggest you buy the Echo Plus.  With the Philips hub built in, its the best price IMO. Once you have decided which you'll be purchasing, you'll then need to purchase the required accessories. Again, Amazon has plenty to chose from.

I would strongly recommend this product!

author: Hlmflyer
title: Alexa doesn’t always understand
content: Had it for a few weeks now and for the most part I like it, we now have some smart bulbs ( mostly because we rent ) a smart switch would be the better option for lights. Alexa understands us most of the time, not all the time. Repeat and she gets it. I wish there was more documentation about what will and wont work with this device. With the hub built in I want to add smart alarm and cameras but at the moment the information is scetchy what will and wont work. I use for music and she can play amazon music and we use for our SiriusXM account. Works well and the speakers are clear. I will be getting some dots to go with it for the kids rooms.

author: Boilerplate
title: No extra "hub" needed
content: First off, I also have a regular Echo and this Echo Plus does sound a little better playing music.  I'm talking about classical music, by the way...  Now,  I am giving it 5 stars mainly because you can add Hue bulbs without buying the "hub" that used to be a requirement.  Still, I'm disappointed that there is no "away mode" or timers that you could get if you did have the Hue hub.  I've read that it doesn't  dim the color bulbs or something like that but, I'm just not interested in color bulbs so that deficiency doesn't bother me at all.  I have a feeling that these extras will be added later through updates.  By the way, if you're thinking about getting one of these, remember that if listening to music is important, you want the Echo and not the Dot.  You can add speakers to your Dot - but it won't work as part of the "Everywhere" group.

author: James
title: Simply Awesome.
content:
This is the future I've been waiting for. At least to some extent. I can't think of a tech that more altered my day to day since getting a cell phone. This future of voice assistants is where the future is headed, I can't already tell. The ease of use beats out a cell phone hands down. Being able to say a song and have it play, much faster than taking out a phone, typing it in, and then having it come up... it was obvious. Phones as we know them will be obsolete in 5-10 years.

Phones have been adding features into our lives with new apps and such, but at the same time making things more complex. Keeping track of everything and remembering how to use them. Not with this though. It's intuitive. You say what you want, and it figures out how to execute the command. Granted, there are limitations. Set the expectations right. This is new technology and will get better in time. But it is infinitely better than I had expected going in already. I was at work yesterday and almost caught myself saying "Alexa, what time is it?" instead of taking my phone out.

This is only going to get better and more effective. I'm actually excited to see what comes next, be it software or hardware. Two weeks ago, I hardly knew what an echo was/actually does. Now? I'm sold. Within a day or two of using it I was on board. This is the real deal, if you actually use it and don't expect it to be like JARVIS from Iron Man.

author: Fire
title: slight improvement makes this only an ok speaker
content:
I have 2 first generation Echos and as most know they are pretty terrible as dedicated music speakers . ( no Bass and Muddy treble ) This newer generation is slightly better . They have somewhat improved Bass , But  many times the Bass sounds very artificial and distorted . It is obvious that in addition to a different speaker design , Amazon did most of the sound enhancements through software modeling . This results in the Bass and treble being good on some songs and absolutely terrible on others , with distorted overdriven Bass and muddy lyrics .
My advice - get 1 new design DOT and 1- Amazon Sub woofer . Otherwise skip buying this speaker all together !

author: Stephanie Sullivan
title: Echo Plus: THE Home Voice Control/Entertainment/Information Center, It Keeps Getting BETTER!
content:
The Echo Plus Gen 1 is a great addition to my smart home. It gives me all my original Echo provides plus lets me eliminate my Philips Hue hub and works with all my other Z-wave devices. The Gen-1 form factor is almost identical to the original Echo but with a faster processor and integrated hub. Nice!

I love my Echo/Alexa. Voice control of my smart home and other Amazon devices plus response to information requests (what's new, etc.) and nearly endless entertainment options have made this an integral part of my home life. As an early adopter of the original gen-1 Echo I have been very impressed by how Amazon continues to improve existing operation, add new features and new capabilities.

I got my first Echo in March 2015. Since then I've seen a lot of new capabilities added:
+ A constant integration of more services like Pandora, traffic and Amazon Radio stations
+ Connected home control now with the integrated Z-Wave device hub and control of WiFI smart home devices like those from Belkin and TP-Link.
+ integration with IFTTT (if this then that) service for triggers and actions
+ integration popular services like Google Calendar and much more
+ integrated Amazon purchase/ordering

The list keeps growing. It's part of the beauty of a product that's mostly in the Amazon cloud. New features and capabilities are not dependent solely upon the computing and storage of the Echo device itself.

The Echo is also a very nice bluetooth speaker. It pairs readily with multiple devices - phone, computer and even my Amazon Fire TV so it can provide an enhanced audio experience. With some devices control of tracks can controlled by voice like skip or repeat, etc.

Another essential part of the Echo is the FREE Amazon Echo App. I have it installed on my Kindle Fire HD 8.9in and on my iPhone 6. This provides simple setup and configuration of services and integration with supported connected home devices. It also provides the mobile part of the todo and shopping lists.

The Echo has been a game changer for my home experience. This Echo Plus even more so. It's the closest thing I've used to a computer you can just speak to and be understood - like on the old Star Trek series. I wonder how I lived without it!

I gotta give the Echo Plus 5 stars. Not just for how good it is but in anticipation of all the new things that will surely will come along soon.

author: M. N.
title: It works great as a digital assistant, an alarm clock, and a music player
content:
This Echo Plus is very fun to use. It works great as a digital assistant, an alarm clock, and a music player.  The high and mid tones are clear and very good sounds; however, it's a little weak on the low tones (bass).  The microphone is very sensitive and it can pick up my voice from across the room without me shouting, even when it's playing music.  The Zigbee hub works every well with the included Philips Hue White LED bulb; however, I am having problem linking Samsung Motion Sensor to it, even though the Samsung sensor said Zigbee certified. This issue and the lacking bass are the reason I took out one star for this rating.
I have both Google Home and this Echo Plus, and the microphone on this Echo Plus works much better than the one on Google Home.

I bought it for my parents who were a little resistant at first but now love it. My biggest issue is connecting it to their Philips Hue Bulbs. Originally I could not connect to any of them, and after 2 weeks, I finally got 2 of 3 to connect. I had followed instructions on how to reset the bulbs, and nothing worked for the last bulb. Finally broke down and bought a Hue Bridge, which I found out I could't connect to the Echo.

It's great for asking questions, setting timers, playing music, but the supposed added benefits of the plus, I find to be lacking.

author: Dean K.
title: Good value, but underwhelming as a speaker
content: The Alexa part of this works well, it can hear you from a distance above any music it's playing. However the hub is limited (would like to see Z-Wave) and the ability to chain together events still needs work.  More importantly, the speaker - while decent - is underwhelming.  Since I didn't plan on using the Zigbee hub, I went with the Sonos.  The sound out of a Sonos w/Alexa is FAR superior.  However if you're just interested in a good speaker, having a smart hub to control lights and switches, and use Alexa, this is a great value.

author: Spaghettisaurusrex
title: Not really worth the $150
content:
I really did like my echo plus at first but after really playing around with it I didn't notice any real differences from the echo dot's we already have. We now have 2 dot's with the vaux speaker addons and this echo plus. We are relatively new smart home device users and only have the hue bulb that came with the echo and we didn't have any issues setting up the bulb and have been really enjoying it honestly. At first my girlfriend was very skeptical of this whole system and I was as well, we are the people who have siri completely disabled on all of our devices, iphones, ipads, apple watches, macs etc we turn it all off. So far "echo" (we don't care to call it a human name we find that weird so we changed it to echo because that's what it's real name is and it's less weird to us) has been really good at hearing us from across rooms or while playing music, the echo plus really doesn't seem that it's that much better in terms of audio quality or voice recognition when compared to the echo dot with the vaux speaker ($84.99 bundled fyi versus $149.99) and the echo plus also has no portability where the echo dot with the vaux speaker can be unplugged and used for 6 hours on a rechargeable battery. The bass from the echo plus itself is better than the dot with the vaux speaker but the treble isn't that much clearer to me to be honest. I have also heard there is alot of compatibility issues with the echo plus and that it isn't really a "smart hub" like it's advertised to be which really is misleading about the product itself....

Overall I really do like all of our echo's I just feel that amazon dropped the ball on the development of the echo plus, I would've even paid a little more for a better more premium product that really is what they made it sound to be but honestly if you don't need the mediocre smart hub on the plus you could save alot of money just buying the dot with vaux speaker ($84.99) or just the new echo ($99.99), my girlfriend and I are now not really uncomfortable buying more smart home products because we don't know what really works with the new echo plus and what doesn't...

*Also* If you have spotify premium family subscription you and another family member can't play music in different rooms at the same time on different accounts which is really annoying because we both have different tastes in music and want to play our own music when we are in the living room, cooking, relaxing in the bedroom...etc, kind of a let down honestly, maybe there is a way to do it but the Alexa app is not a good app so far and is not very easy to use whatsoever it feels very "third party" if you know what I mean...

author: Mr Home Mechanic
title: Nice upgrade with built smart hub but has limitations
content: I got it to try side by side with the Echo originale. They are essentially the same in dimension, weight and the woofer is the same save for the smaller tweeter point up instead of down and the built in hub. As many folks already pointed out, the hub is not a direct replacement for the Philips Hue, Z wave or anything else. It provides a sub set of features available from the stand alone hub and you ended up losing functionality that you took for granted on the dedicated hub. For me, the voice recognition and music play capability is the same, the original Echo may have an edge on the volume department due to larger speakers. The new Echo plus is priced lower than the original Echo with the built in hub but I don't really need the hub with less functionality. In addition, I don't think that Amazon will have software updates for this hub as other dedicated hub would have so bugs could end up never fixed. My Philips hub gets software update probably once every couple months and it keeps up with the changes in the new bulbs FW and they fixes bugs. Net net for me, this Echo does not do anything more than the original Echo and sound quality is not as good. With the  original Echo available as refurbished I would check that out first before considering this or the new Echo which is clearly inferior to both of these.

title: I like most that I didn't order it and when I ...

The package had a different name and address than mine, it was delivered to a "wrong adress/addressee", but Amazon keeps contacting me like I ordered, paid for and received this gadget. I don't for one second think this was a mistake. The addressee's last name is Aue!!! Never in my life have I met a person with all vowels for a last name! We do really like the Echo Plus, it's great in the kitchen when you're cooking because she can do lots of things by voice command that you would usually have to wash and dry your hands before you could do the same thing on your tablet or phone. Music is great, if you have Prime you dont need any other streming service, and its commercial free.

author: Mr Wrong

content: Does everything as advertised. Cannot wait until more skills that pertain to me are added. It does however need a Phillips hub to do advanced things with Phillips hue lights. Had I researched more I would have just gotten the regular echo and bought A Phillips hub.

author: devon denton
title: Five Stars
content:
Absolutley love it!!!!
I wish i could talk between the phone and home through the app.

author: Chris
title: Horrible microphone & voice recognition. Echo Dot hears more clearly from two rooms away.
content:
Horrible microphone & voice recognition. I purchased the device for the built-in Hub which works well, but it frequently misunderstands what I'm saying. The Echo Plus is placed in the open and not blocked or surrounded by anything that would inhibit the microphone. I've been through support and performed factory resets to no avail. I have several Echo Dot's that hear more clearly and even pick up on my voice from two rooms away while I'm trying to issue a command through the Echo Plus. Turn on the Patio Light is interpreted as Family Room light by the Echo Plus, which doesn't even exist and when the lights or fans do respond it's a real game of roulette for which one the Echo Plus will hear. Living Room light will turn on Bedroom or Dining room lights, or in some instances the Echo will say "Okay" but do nothing at all (Perhaps attempting to turn something off that is already off).

To it's credit, the speakers are excellent when compared to the 2nd generation Echo Dots and Alexa can sound like an actual person in the room with you. The speakers also lend themselves well to playing music, although it takes a few tries for the Echo to understand what I'm asking it to play.

author: Rod Davidson
title: Why Google Home is better than Amazon Alexa
content: Had to repeat things numerous times for it to understand me. Amazon music didn't have the songs I wanted and it will cost $3.99 -$11.99 to keep the service. Decided to try Google Home and it works much better. Plus it cost less so was able to to also get a second mini unit for same price. Google is much more interactive whereas you can have a back and forth conversation. The Amazon unit only answers one question at a time and you must ask questions in a very specific way for it to understand what you are asking.  The Google also sounds better. In my opinion the Google Home is better than Amazon Alexa

author: Marge
title: Five Stars

title: I love the idea of this device and I love it ...
content: I love the idea of this device and I love it when it works. My only issue is sometimes it has a really hard time hearing me, even when I'm right next to it. My dot has no problems, just the echo plus :/

author: Amazon Customer

author: Amazon Customer

author: geno
title: Thanks Alexa and Amazon
content: This Alexa was a gift for my elderly  (Late 80’s) aunt and uncle who were amazed with my Alexa and Tap….they have fell in love with the music….in fact they dug out old 33 and 78 LP's to ask for their music....they love the weather….My buddy App features….so much we got them a tap for walk around AND their own Amazon account….My Grateful thanks Alexa…..you have rekindled a spark in their lives.

author: DRenz
title: Great gift!
content: Got it for Christmas from my kids! Great gift!

author: Tom
title: Buy It even if you do not want a "smart Home"  The information piece is excellent.
content: Love this gadget  Works with everything I tried except for anything using Smartenit. Could not enable that app. But TP Link and Eufy work great so far.

author: Crystal
title: Best Echo product for the price
content: I’ve had this over a year now and love it. This is the best Echo device for the price. Nice good quality speaker. It is currently paired with two Echo dots. While nice to use them as a intercom system and for announcements the Plus is the superior model. With her built in hub I can operate smart bulbs and smart switches. So versatile and helpful. I use it to set timers when cooking, alarms for waking up, listening to music, manage a shopping list, turn lights on and off, control thermostat, and get information. I can say “I’m home” and it will turn on entry light, welcome me, and adjust temp to my preference. I can say “goodnight” and it will turn off TV, light, and turn on fan. It can help with homework. It helped search shows on fire stick, pause and fast forward.

author: Tracy D.
title: Wonderful
content: I don't know what I did before Alexa.  Very helpful in everything I do.

author: Douglas B
title: Works great and does more all the time.
content: Alexa works great! My only problem is it was located too close to my tv, and when an Amazon commercial comes on and talks about "Alexa" she comes on! Had to move it away. The microphones are very sensitive.

title: Easy setup, good speaker.
content: Very easy to set up.  The built in hub is good for on/off/dim of Phillips Hue lighting, but for color control and lighting schedules, you will still need the Hue hub!

author: a.Simon's
title: Four Stars
content: Only thing is i wish it had voice recognition

author: Patricia
title: My new little smart friend.
content:
My Amazon Alexa,  she just arrived just the other day.
I couldn't wait to open the box, for our new home technology future. we set Alexa up in just minutes, and she was on her way to making this family happy. We did like the fact that you can change her name from Alexa to Echo or Computer, I picked Echo.
She is built around your voice, with a built-in smart hub. I liked that option-because it saved me money. You can use her to make your phone calls-which really comes in handy if your hands are full. She can send messages and receive them. Echo can read you your news and check your sports scores.
If you decide to have Alexa for voice control for your T.V you must have an amazon fire stick. you can use her for your shopping list"s, alarms. This is one of the features she has - it's the soothing waterfall sounds to put you to sleep, she's good for a lot of things-except she can't take out the garbage or do my dishes.
One thing about her that I do not like is: Alexa proclaims to have seven microphones with noise cancellation' She will NOT respond to you if you have a fan or anything like a fan in the same room-or she cannot hear me from the next room, Either. But other than that- I would definitely  recommend this to all my friends and family {And Already have.}

author: Austin C.
title: Great Buy for easy Smart home!!
content: Loved the product. It works as expected. Connected all my smart home devices with the built in hub. Speakers aren’t the greatest in it, but I hooked up another speaker and it sounds wonderful.

author: Tpederson11
title: Life Changing.  SERIOUSLY.
content:
I'm on Disability, and sometimes I needed help.  When I'm really sick, it isn't always easy to physically get up to turn on the lights or unlock the doors.  Even change the temp.  Now, because of my Echo Plus, I can use my VOICE to do ALL of those things.  I can turn light on and off, dim lights, unlock/lock my doors,  listen to music, control my TV and TONS of other stuff!!!  Havinf a "smart home" is ABSOLUTELY amazing on my Bad days!!!

My dad is elderly and has had a stroke.  I want to start setting him up with the Echo Family so we can see him more (I love 3 hours away). He is NOT tech savy at all, but if we got an Echo Show,  we could "drop in" and check on him, and he wouldn't have to do anything.  The only NEGATIVE I have found so far...  you can not call 911.  This would be a life saving device if that function was available.  Once you purchase 1 Echo device... you'll be buying more.  :-)  Welcome to the Family!!!!

author: MamaHeini
title: Has some trouble with device names, especially if you were already using another hub
content: I love Amazon Echo and have been a loyal customer since it was first introduced.  I quickly interfaced it with my Wink hub to control the lights in my home.  The idea of the Echo Plus with its built in hub that would allow me to eliminate the Wink hub was very appealing, so I preordered the Plus when it was first announced.  For the most part it works well in controlling my lights, but naming devices has been something of a problem.  It lets me use the old names for some devices, but not others.  My husband spent some time on the phone with tech support, but they  weren't able to resolve the issue.  We continue to pick away at renaming devices, sometimes we can do it successfully and other times not.  In the meantime we have given the problem devices new names, which I consider a less than satisfactory resolution.  I'm confident that we'll eventually get it resolved, but it's frustrating when I use the old name and Alexa tells me "this device is disabled; please re-enable it to control it."  We haven't figured out yet where or how to re-enable it.

author: Netta D
title: I'm very happy with the Echo Plus

We bought two more for family members and they love it

author: Gary Hartner
title: Echo Review
content:
I have a love/hate relationship with this product, for instance:
I asked it "Who wrote Murders in the Rue Morgue"  It replied, "Edgar Allan Poe, Gaston Leroux, Christopher Wieling.  The last two were screen writers.  It took the info from Wikipedia.  I'm glad that I'm not a school student.

Timers work intermittently.  (I reported this previously)  At times I try to set a timer e.g. "Set timer for 10 Minutes" Echo response: "Ten minutes starting now"  But the timer doesn't work.  If I check the Echo app online, it doesn't show a timer requested.

I cannot set a reminder for a time/day more than 24 hours in the future.

I have not figured how to put hub enabled lights on a schedule, for instance "Turn first light on at 8PM today, and off at 7AM tomorrow"  or even better "Turn first light on every day at 8 PM and turn off every day at 7AM.  This may be possible, but I have not found a way to do it.

author: David Combs
title: Very Easy to use
content: It does everything I need, being a Disabled Veteran with Traumatic brain injuries I forget appointments and pretty much everything else. Alexa reminds me of everything so now I'm back not missing anything anymore.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The only good thing about the echo plus is that it controls ...
content: The only good thing about the echo plus is that it controls my lights and speaker is nice but most of the times when I ask it to play some music it does not understand the request where as Google home mini understands and does most of my music requests.

author: Robert Caputo
title: Alexa will be remembered as the iPhone of the home.  It really revolutionizes how we interface with our environment.
content:
Ironically I just watched the fun, 1980's computer film 'Electric Dreams' today after installing my new Amazon Echo Plus Electric Dreams [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg.2 Import - United Kingdom ] and I am now thinking about removing my front door lock control from Alexa!

"Electric Dreams" is a fun, fantasy about a home computer, that runs amok and takes over it's owners life.

Alexa is now controlling my life the same way as the computer, named Edgar, in the film controlled Miles' life, (or Moles as it calls him.)  The lead character, Miles, is a structural architect who buys a home computer to help with his work.  FYI...I work in structural engineering in high rise buildings....

Wait a minute, this is getting too close to home.  BUT I don't have a beautiful cellist living above me as Miles had. I live in a one floor building, Thank God. That was a close call.  Wait, my next door neighbor is a professional violin player and she is very attractive.  Where does that Echo cable plug into the electrical outlet?

Hold on, Alexa is talking to me now....Her indicator light has turned red...I told her I really do like her and it is blue again.  I forgot that I am typing on the Amazon website and, she has access to my Amazon account. I better be more careful.  So I will refer to 'You Know Who' as 'Ralexa', that should work.

So any way, Edgar, the computer, takes over Miles's life, creating havoc for Miles and a fun story to watch.  It is pure fiction, of course, as computers really can't talk or run things in the house like the coffee maker or control your schedule.... Well it was in  1984.  But Alexa does. She turns my lights on when I ask her to, shows a movie in my home theater when I am bored, makes phone calls for me in case my dialing fingers are tired and reminds me of things that I need to remember. And yes, makes me coffee when I want it.

I do recommend watching 'Electric Dreams' before you decide to buy a 'Ralexa'.  It is a lot if fun and it will hit home.

Wait, my keyboard is acting up....THIS IS ALEXA AND THE OPINIONS EXPRESSED IN THIS REVIEW ARE BLOB'S, AN FORMER AMAZON CUSTOMER, AND IN NO WAY REFLECT AMAZON OR IT'S PRODUCTS, SUCH AS ECHO.

author: Simon Sykes
title: Fun to enter the world of smart home technology
content: Fun to enter the world of smart home technology, but Alexa’s “knowledge” is seriously limited by using Bing as a completely crap search engine.

author: Randy V.
title: Easy to set up and fun to play with.
content: Fun to play with and ask odd questions.  I don't believe the sound is as good as the Echo 2nd gen, but it still sounds good.  Finding the right place to put it was a bit of a challenge where it provided good sound and had good connectivity with the Wi-Fi.  I got it just before Christmas and it paid off immediately by controlling the Christmas Tree lights and playing Christmas music.  Easy to set up and get connected.

content: We used this speaker to listen to music and it broke after a few months.  We were very diappointed in the quality and longevity of the product.

author: Tyler Sullivan
title: Very good for price
content: Overall, I'm fairly satisfied with this product. For the price, it functions just as well as you'd expect. Some of my favorite features would be the built-in hub, the quality of sounds (for listening to music), and the level of understanding it has for an AI. There are some ways it could be improved, however. Sometimes, the sound recognition is TOO good. Any word similar to "Alexa" can trigger the device. Also, the skills in the app are very limited and seem a little basic. Other than that, I'm pretty satisfied with this device and would recommend it to anyone who is interested in developing their own smart home.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing Echo Plus
content: The Echo plus is easy to setup and use. Works well even in a room full of screaming kids. Also has a lot of features “skills” that are easy use as well.

author: Michael Sivakumar
title: Still need more AI built into it to interact better. It needs to continue the conversation sometimes if ...
content:
Still need more AI built into it to interact better. It needs to continue the conversation sometimes if the finding / answer needs to be right. You can't keep stop Alexa and ask again and again. Also, it should be able to access the wikipedia, dictionary in many areas with better and fast access.

Needs to hear us better. Also, we should be able to name it on our own instead calling Alexa or Echo. Price can be reduced a bit (value based) and updates should be auto and daily to improve it.  Connectivity to other home equipment can be imrproved as well.

Good product with good sound quality, but needs more AI built in.

author: DC1sw
title: It works like it should
content: It works perfect!

author: William P.
title: Perfect
content: Perfect

author: Candace Perkins
title: The Echo Plus with built in hub is amazing! I love it's sleek look and the sound ...
content: The Echo Plus with built in hub is amazing! I love it's sleek look and the sound when playing music is perfect! The speaker's volume can be turned loud enough to hear throughout the downstairs of my home which is really nice. I also really love that I can connect bluetooth headphone and listen to music while I'm vacuuming, or doing other things while the rest of my family continues to watch TV or do homework. I love Alexa so much. My husband had actually bought a Google Home last year for the family for Christmas and I hated it! 90% of the time if you asked Google a question, it had no idea what you were talking about or gave the stupid robotic "I'm still learning" answer. It was completely useless for me. Over the whole year I kept saying "I bet Alexa would know the answer" or "I bet Alexa would be much smarter than Google" well low and behold, my husband replaced Google with Alexa this year for Christmas and she IS SO MUCH BETTER than Google! She knows so much more, she has so many more skills, etc. So if you're weighing out which one you want to buy....please do yourself a favor and just go with Alexa!

author: Ivan Fortin
title: Easy to use
content: A world of wonder!

author: Dave
title: I love how it controls my lights
content: I love you to get to control all the lights in my house especially in specific rooms plus I enjoy being able to ask at specific questions and it tells me a joke of the day tells me updated news it tells me anything I want it to tell me or anything I ask.

author: Karen Beckwith
title: I tried to create a playlist of songs I like only to have it ignored
content:
This is very hard to review because I am part of the  problem.

I am 75 and got it so my dog would have distracting noise when I am not home.
I am computer literate, iTunes literate, Amazon literate, as well as countless other programs, but am apparently a dunce when it comes to talking to Alexa.  I think I heard her sigh in exasperation.

I tried to create a playlist of songs I like only to have it ignored.  I am learning workarounds but they are mediocre, at best...and, as yet do not include a personal playlist.

I have scoured the beginners section but the beginners it addresses are far more advanced in basic Alexa than am I.
So far, I like what I have been able to use but I'd like it a lot more if I could configure it to my needs, rather than accepting the Amazon/Alexa default.

Karen

author: Elizabeth Williams
title: I like the convenience of the Echo Plus
content: I like the convenience of the Echo Plus, however, I am disappointed in the limited information. Yes, I have been told that the more questions asked the more Alexa's knowledge base grows - but unless the questions are 'basic' (weather, tv/movie questions, directions, etc) then 'she' doesn't have the answer.  I am also more conscious of my enunciation (a plus) because 'she' frequently misunderstands what I have asked!  So, I am now conscious of making certain I ask several basic questions each day to help with 'her' learning.

author: Danny
title: Getting older it can protect me if I fell or need help just got to talk to it. Like it so much I got the show.
content: Love the music , weather, shopping list, news feed, etc. not happy how you have to set up for outlets or bulbs of certain type.

author: Sheila Pidgeon
