author: Richard
title: This is a great device with more potential than I will be using
content: This is a great device with more potential than I will be using. Received the LED bulb with my purchase and placed it in a floor lamp and Alexa will turn it on to various brightness with my voice. It also has excellent sound, listen to Pandora radio, and you can move it wherever you want. I have not installed them yet, but I purchased a set of LED strip lights for under my cabinets in the kitchen that also work with Alexa. I have found that Alexa will hear you best in close vicinity or you may find yourself raising your voice in order for her to understand you, say with a TV on in the background. This is the only reason I did not give it 5 stars.

author: Charles G.
title: I simply LOVE my ECHO PLUS
content: I simply LOVE my ECHO PLUS. It's extremely useful. It's like having Webster and a human at the same time.

author: Dan the Man
title: Great Device - Deceptive Advertising - Bad App and Bad Instructions
content:
The Echo Plus is an awesome piece of equipment, I absolutely love it!

However, Amazon is PURPOSELY vague/deceptive on the capability of their equipment/software.  For example, the site specifically states the hub is a ZigBee hub, yet it DOES NOT specifically state the hub is NOT AT ALL compatible with Z-Wave.  This is fully deceptive marketing, just state what your product CAN NOT DO!!!!!!!!!!!

Also, Z-WAVE device advertisements on Amazon flat out state they are fully compatible with Alexa, this is FLAT OUT FALSE, and I consider this to be and industry wide marketing LIE!!!!!!!  You CAN NOT connect Z-WAVE devices to this hub, no matter what you read, Amazon will not tell you this unless you buy the hub, connect it, trouble shoot, give up and call them.  Then they say "oh... looks like the hub is NOT compatible with you Z-WAVE devices, we can allow you to return all the Z-Wave equipment so you can buy more expensive ZigBee products (which probably contain Chinese hack Software).  Rediclous, just be HONEST and tell your customers what your device can an can not do, otherwise you are a bunch of big fat ADVERTISING LIARS.

With that said, to connect Z-WAVE to the Alexa hub, you have to buy a separate Z-WAVE hub, something their tech support will not tell you.  Oh, also, don't trust the FAQ's/help page on the App, they suggest it is simple and you just find you device and the hub (which everyone thinks they just bought a hub because they have the echo plus) but it is %100 WRONG.  You will not know the GE Z-Wave instructions are flat out FALSE until you talk to customer service and they act like you should have known you need a different hub.

One other thing that is irritating is that you have to wipe Amazon devices back to factory just to update your WiFi password.  If you follow the instructions, it will say this is a last resort.  WRONG WRONG WRONG!!!!!  Not only is this wrong, but I had to teach Amazon that you have to reset their equipment not once, but twice to get it to work.  Then I had to do the full setup again.  To be fair, this applies to their devices which have screens.

The last comment I have is the Alexa App, it has to be the least professional App, least intuitive App, most difficult App on the planet.  It is a TURD.  Why do you not have the same capability on the App within no screen devices for devices which have screens?  Basically you can not control/setup screen devices using the app.  THIS IS JUST STUPID!!!!!

Advise to Amazon:.

Why ruin such an amazing product by supplying a crappy user interface and false/deceptive advertising? Especially the crappy home automation directions, and hub connections?  When you read these instructions, they are FULLY deceptive.

author: Kathleen Turner
title: Could not find my dog food for ordering also could ...
content: Could not find my dog food for ordering also could not answer questions I asked her to look up.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awful speaker, doesn’t respond to voice commands
content: This is a review after 6 months of use. Alexa randomly starts talking when no one has said “Alexa”. She’s always listening and recording. Alexa doesn’t understand commands. Alexa repeats exactly what you said and then says she can’t perform the task. You have to repeat the command several times. I find it easier just to use the app to perform task rather than tell Alexa to do it, which kind of defeats the purpose. The speaker quality is subpar. At certain volumes the sound is distorted. There’s no way to adjust bass or treble settings. In the Alexa app, you can’t set the alarm for certain days. The options in the app are Daily, Weekly, Weekdays, or Weekends. I don’t need the alarm for Mondays and Fridays. So I have to select the Weekdays option and remember to turn it off for Mondays and Friday. But with all this technology I shouldn’t have to do this. I don’t recommend this product.

author: Carnivorousgnar
title: Needs improvement

author: Mila M Elfman
title: A little inconsistent but good to have
content: My husband loves ordering Alexa around.  "Alexa, play this; Alexa, play that; Alexa, volume down; Alexa, what's this?"  She doesn't always respond, but most of the time does.  She does not always understand a song request or question, when it seems she should.  A little inconsistent.

author: Adam Loeffler
title: Awesome smart speaker; Lame smart home hub
content: If you are looking for a smart home hub, this is not for you. It will control objects, but it’s definitely not smart. You can turn in lights and turn them off, but can’t schedule anything. However, the speaker is great and delivers rich, room filling sound.

author: Norman Stewart
title: You have to get use to echo being in the ...
content: You have to get use to echo being in the same room. Such as you can't talk about her when in the same room

author: Douglas F. Eggli
title: They don’t tell you everything you need to know
content: Alexa’s voice recognition and “understanding” are hit and miss.  The Alexa app for my iPhone just quits regularly.  I have to relaunch it when it quits.  Speaker quality for music is +/-.  The echo plus hub only supports some of my WIFI Smart devices.  It does not support GE and Lutron.  GE makes one of the few 3-way smart dimmers and Lutron makes the only smart light switch that works without a neutral wire.  So I have an echo plus and two more hubs, one for Lutron and one for GE.  Depending on the Smart Devices you need, you may need multiple hubs.  Echo plus will not be your entire solution.  Buyer beware.

author: Tinkermarybelle

Could have paid $30 for the cheapest Alexa .. VERY FRUSTRATING from an end-user perspective to have all these "smart" products that do not seemlessly integrate. ;(

title: All is awesome. It doesn't come with internal battery
content:
Pros: Sound quality is great and you have a cheaper speaker than what is around. Being a hub for Amazon and having Alexa is great.

Cons: you need to be close to the mic, when the room is big you need to find a neutral spot right? well this doesn't come with internal battery.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This thing is awesome!!
content: This thing is awesome!!! For me, I wanted a good Bluetooth speaker that wasn’t gonna break the bank and the Amazon Echo delivers awesome sound and so much more with Amazon Music. It delivers in every way!! Your probably gonna get even more out of it if you have Alexa enabled devices like a thermostat or lights that you can control with Alexa. I have no complaints and no regrets and I’m looking into purchasing another one for another room in my house.

title: best investment and it worth every penny.
content: I am very happy with the sounds quality. I can hear all the base details of the instruments,  as if I was sitting in the front row of an orchestra . That is why we have bought 3 echo plus! one suggestion-wish it had a wider base so it won't fall.
